meanings.definition: The end of a period of time
meanings.sent1: The expiry of the school year brought summer vacation.
meanings.sent2: The expiry of the lease meant it was time to find a new apartment.
meanings.sent3: At the expiry of the movie, the audience clapped and cheered.
meanings.sent4: The expiry of the day was marked by the setting sun.
meanings.sent5: The expiry of the coupon was a reminder to use it before it expired.

meanings.definition: The termination of a contract or agreement
meanings.sent1: The expiry of the insurance policy required renewal.
meanings.sent2: The expiry of the employment contract led to a search for a new job.
meanings.sent3: The expiry of the deal left both parties looking for alternatives.
meanings.sent4: The expiry of the rental agreement meant it was time to move out.
meanings.sent5: The expiry of the warranty left the customer without coverage.

meanings.definition: The act of exhaling or breathing out
meanings.sent1: After the race, the runner's expiry was visible in the mist.
meanings.sent2: Yoga focuses on the controlled expiry and inhale of breath.
meanings.sent3: The doctor asked the patient to demonstrate a deep expiry.
meanings.sent4: The singer's powerful voice filled the room with each expiry.
meanings.sent5: The diver's expiry created bubbles that rose to the surface of the water.
